reviews.review:
I pulled the game out of the depths of my library to catch up on the missing achievements and saw that I haven't written a review yet. So, let's catch up on that:

I played both games back to back and I like the second one better for several reasons:

- Wheatley is awesome and so you have Glados AND Wheatley together.
- I like best the game sections that are outside the normal test chambers and the second part has more of them.
- the puzzles with the gels are a great innovation and fun

Valve has really created something great and anyone who has not played the Portal games should do so immediately.

I'll play Portal Stories Mel right after this, just like I did back then. Because this game (btw one of many unique mods for Portal, which are available for free in the Steam Store) contains something: tests where you have to puzzle to solve them and where it does not depend on skill. 
That would be the only criticism I have of the Portal games. Some test chambers and sections of the game have to do with timing and that can be very annoying, especially if you want to play comfortably and relaxed.
Good story, but AMAZING multiplayer experience, even years after its initial release it still holds up.

My favorite puzzle game, ever. The single-player story is fantastic, playing through the 2-player mode is a blast, and the workshop support offers endless replay value. The praise surrounding the game is 100% earned. Valve, for the love of God please make Portal 3.

One of the best games ever.
The start and end are the best parts.
For the cheap price you get many things:
-singleplayer
-coop
-extras
-...
The only thing that I probably should have done that I would recommend to all others is to play Portal 1 first.
